Articles.Content:
You can post your favourite mods out there, that you're using now.

I personaly recommend KSP Interstellar because it adds some future, but theoritically possible tech like fusion reactors, it is also the best warp drive mod, instead of adding OP engine it adds a device, that makes you go to speed of light instantaneously an when deactivated it decelerates you to your previous speed.
EVE+ Astronemers visual pack. It's amazing. And VOID. Excelent for planetary transfers and delta-v readout.
Definitely Kerbal Engineer. WHo has time for math in a video game?! XD
Kerbal Alarm Clock. If you are ever doing multiple missions at the same time, it is almost essential.

EVE+ Astronemers visual pack. It's amazing. And VOID. Excelent for planetary transfers and delta-v readout.

Yeah I'm using them too (EVE and Astronomer's)
Editor Extensions. Once you use it you're lost without it.
remote tech 2 adds difficulty for unmaned mission
Kerbal Engineer, Kerbal Alarm Clock, Precision Nodes. Essential mods. Enhanced Nav ball and Chatterer are next. Rest I can live without.

Kerbal Alarm Clock

VOID (mostly I use the HUD, but it's excellent)

PreciseNode
